div.p: Chaffey College was established by the Chaffey brothers in 1885. It focused mainly on agriculture because it was a pivotal part of the colony’s development. Spanish colonial revival architectural design was utilized when building the college as well as many other important buildings and houses throughout the city. Although a beautiful architectural technique, it overshadowed the Mexican and Mexican-American culture that had already been established there. The incoming settlers wanted to create a space of their own and slowly push away the residents that had lived there for decades.

note.p: The Spanish colonial revival architectural design overshadowed the Mexican culture, which had been long established.
